text: The 1899 FA Cup Final was contested by Sheffield United and Derby County at Crystal Palace. Sheffield United won 4–1, with four second-half goals scored by Jack Almond, Walter Bennett, Billy Beer and Fred Priest after John Boag had scored a first-half opener for County. This was Derby's second successive losing final and worse was to come in that regard in 1903 against Bury.Derby County: The Story of a football club (abridged sample, page 21), Anton Rippon, 2013, The contest was photographed by Henry Jasper Redfern. ==Match details== {| width=92% | |- | | |} {| style="width:100%;" |- | style="vertical- align:top; width:50%;"| {| style="font-size: 90%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" |- |colspan="4"| |- !width="25"| !!width="25"| |- | || ||Willie Foulke |- | || ||Harry Thickett |- | || ||Peter Boyle |- | || ||Harry Johnson |- | || ||Tom Morren |- | || ||Ernest Needham |- | || ||Walter Bennett |- | || ||Billy Beer |- | || ||George Hedley |- | || ||Jack Almond |- | || ||Fred Priest |- |colspan=4|Club Secretary: |- |colspan="4"|John Nicholson |} | style="vertical-align:top; width:50%;"| {| cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font-size:90%; margin:auto;" |- |colspan="4"| |- !width="25"| !!width="25"| |- | || ||Jack Fryer |- | || ||Jimmy Methven |- | || ||Jonathan Staley |- | || ||John D. Cox |- | || ||Robert Paterson |- | || ||Johnny May |- | || ||Tommy Arkesden |- | || ||Steve Bloomer |- | || ||John Boag |- | || ||Billy MacDonald |- | || ||Harry Allen |- |colspan=4|Manager: |- |colspan="4"|Harry Newbould |} |} ==Road to the Final== Sheffield United were drawn away from home in every round and needed replays on five occasions, including three against Liverpool. ===Sheffield United=== ===Derby County=== ==References== *Line-ups *Match report at www.fa-cupfinals.co.uk *Match report at Observer Sport Monthly 1899 Category:1898–99 in English football Category:Sheffield United F.C. matches Category:Derby County F.C. matches Category:April 1899 sports events
